column4: hey guys I have problem I cant start my firefox just from terminal why?
how are you trying to launch firefox outside of the terminal? can you try /usr/bin/firefox ?
please tell me how to write in my terminal , then can I fix it :)
Im tried the 2 ways alt f2 + ctrl
have you used the full path? /usr/bin/firefox ? instead of just firefox?
oh.. when you're launching firefox in terminal.. you're doing it as root? does it launch as your normal user?
can you launch firefox in a terminal as YOUR user?
what does it give you when you type firefox in a terminal window?
it gives me nothing nothing happens
I must do sudo bash first then can I write firefox
seems like the issue is with your .mozilla (and your account)
have you tried to mv ~/.mozilla ~/mozillaold and reopen mozilla?
reinstalling firefox will not do anything to ~/.mozilla
you'll be missing your history and bookmarks..
